description: A simple frontend for shielding tokens in RAILGUN - enables users to shield (make private) their ERC-20 tokens using the RAILGUN privacy protocol

github_repository.name: token-shielder
github_repository.description: 🛡️ A simple frontend for shielding tokens in RAILGUN

data_storage.purpose: Client-side encrypted data storage for RAILGUN wallet state

railgun_protocol.description: On-chain ZK privacy ecosystem that uses Zero-Knowledge Proofs (zk-SNARKs) to ensure transaction privacy

cryptographic_primitives.proof_system: zk-SNARK (Zero-Knowledge Succinct Non-Interactive Argument of Knowledge)
cryptographic_primitives.elliptic_curves: Uses Elliptic Curve Cryptography for succinct proof generation
cryptographic_primitives.commitment_scheme: Pedersen commitments via Merkle tree notes
eips_used: EIP-197 (Precompiled contracts for optimal ate pairing check)

circuit_design.circuit_types: Differentiated by number of inputs and outputs
supported_operations: DeFi interactions (e.g., Uniswap v3 liquidity provision)

merkle_tree.shared_tree: All tokens within RAILGUN share the same Merkle Tree
merkle_tree.note_structure: Each shield interaction generates a new note (Root/Leaf on Merkle Tree)
merkle_tree.commitment: Notes are hashed values of public data that cannot be reversed

shielding.description: Move tokens from public wallet to private RAILGUN address (0zk address)

unshielding.description: Move tokens from private RAILGUN address back to public wallet
unshielding.verification: zk-SNARK proof verifies ownership without revealing transaction history

private_transfers.description: Transfer tokens between RAILGUN addresses without revealing sender, receiver, or amount
private_transfers.anonymity_set: All RAILGUN users share the same Merkle tree anonymity set

private_defi.description: Interact with smart contracts privately via cross-contract calls

proof_properties.non_interactive: Proofs do not require interaction between prover and verifier
proof_properties.succinct: Proofs are small and fast to verify
proof_properties.statistically_unforgeable: Proofs are computationally impossible to fake

architecture.type: Client-side application with on-chain privacy protocol

frontend.description: Next.js web application for user interaction
directories: contexts/ - React context providers for state management

railgun_sdk.description: JavaScript/TypeScript libraries for interacting with RAILGUN smart contracts

smart_contracts.description: On-chain Solidity contracts for privacy-preserving operations

data_flow.3_transaction_submission: Transaction with proof submitted to blockchain
data_flow.4_on_chain_verification: Smart contract verifies proof using Snark.sol
data_flow.5_state_update: Merkle tree updated with new commitment/nullifier

security_features.audits: RAILGUN contracts have undergone multiple security audits

proof_of_innocence.functionality: Users can prove their funds are not from sanctioned addresses without revealing transaction history
proof_of_innocence.implementation: Private Proof of Innocence list provider

security_features.no_bridges: No bridge vulnerabilities - uses native chain security
security_features.no_standalone_chain: No separate chain to secure - inherits security from underlying EVM chain

developer_resources.quickstart_sdk: Enables dApp developers to provide privacy to users
developer_resources.cookbook: Tools to write 'Recipes' to convert dApps into zkApps

user_facing: Simple interface for shielding ERC-20 tokens
Support for multiple networks via RainbowKit wallet connection
Client-side encrypted storage for wallet state
No KYC or account creation required

Shared Merkle tree for maximum anonymity set

Cross-contract calls for private DeFi interactions

limitations_and_considerations.gas_costs: zk-SNARK proof verification requires higher gas than standard transfers
limitations_and_considerations.regulatory: Privacy tools may face regulatory scrutiny in some jurisdictions
